# Awaken Your Royal Identity: Reigning in Life Through Christ

![Royal Crown](/blog-images/royal-identity-1.jpg)

## A Personal Invitation to Royalty

Beloved child of God, pause for a moment and breathe in this truth: **You were never designed to live an ordinary life.** The Creator of the universe has placed within you a spark of divine royalty, a calling that transcends your current circumstances and launches you into realms of extraordinary impact.

Have you ever felt that stirring in your spirit—that deep knowing that there must be more to this Christian journey than Sunday services and routine prayers? That stirring is your royal DNA calling out, reminding you of who you truly are in Christ.

> “But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, His own special people…” — 1 Peter 2:9

## The Awakening: Discovering Your True Nature

### When God Said “Let Us Make Man…”

Picture this: The Trinity gathered in counsel before the foundation of the world, their hearts overflowing with love and purpose. The Father speaks with divine excitement, *”Let Us make man in Our image, according to Our likeness; let them have dominion…”* (Genesis 1:26)

This was not a casual suggestion—it was a royal decree! When God breathed His breath into Adam, He wasn’t just creating another creature; He was crowning a king. The Hebrew word for *”dominion”* is **radah**, which means to tread down, to rule, to take precedence. This is the language of kings!

**Pause and Reflect:**
– What areas of your life have you been allowing to “tread down” on you instead of you taking dominion?
– Where have you settled for less than what God intended for you?

![Walking in Authority](/blog-images/royal-identity-2.jpg)

### The Crown Awaits: Living from Victory, Not for Victory

Listen carefully, beloved: **Your royal identity is not something you’re striving to achieve—it’s who you already are.** The moment you received Christ, you were transferred from the kingdom of darkness into the Kingdom of light, from slavery to sonship, from poverty to royal inheritance.

The psalmist declared with wonder: *”What is man that You are mindful of him… For You have made him a little lower than the angels, and You have crowned him with glory and honor.”* (Psalm 8:4-5)

That crown is not waiting for you in heaven—it’s on your head right now! Every challenge you face, every mountain you encounter, every circumstance that rises against you must bow to the crown of glory that adorns your life.

### Prayer of Awakening

*Heavenly Father, open the eyes of my understanding. Let the revelation of my royal identity flood my soul like never before. I refuse to live beneath my privilege any longer. I choose to arise and shine, for my light has come and the glory of the Lord has risen upon me. In Jesus’ mighty name, Amen!*

## The Seven Pillars of Your Royal Reign

### 1. **Authority: Speak and It Shall Be Established**

Kings don’t beg—they decree. When a king speaks, creation rearranges itself to align with his words. This is your heritage in Christ! Job 22:28 declares: *”You will also decree a thing, and it will be established for you.”*

**Practical Activation:**
– Begin each morning by decreeing God’s promises over your life
– When challenges arise, open your mouth and speak God’s Word with authority
– Stop pleading with circumstances and start commanding them to align with heaven

> “Death and life are in the power of the tongue…” — Proverbs 18:21

![Speaking with Authority](/blog-images/royal-identity-3.jpg)

### 2. **Prosperity: The King’s Resources**

Royalty and poverty cannot coexist in God’s economy. Abraham, the father of faith, was so wealthy that kings sought alliances with him. This same Abrahamic blessing flows through your veins today!

But hear this: Divine prosperity is not merely about bank balances—it’s about having **more than enough** to fulfill your divine assignment. It’s about being a conduit of blessing, not a reservoir.

*2 Corinthians 9:8 promises: “And God is able to make all grace abound toward you, that you, always having all sufficiency in all things, may have an abundance for every good work.”*

### 3. **Favor: The Royal Welcome**

When royalty enters a room, doors open without knocking. This is the favor of God working in your life! Psalm 5:12 declares: *”You, O Lord, will bless the righteous; with favor You will surround him as with a shield.”*

Favor will cause people to champion your cause, opportunities to find you, and barriers to dissolve before you. It’s not about your education, your connections, or your abilities—it’s about the crown you carry!

### 4. **Dignity: Carrying Yourself Like the King’s Kid**

There’s something about royalty that commands respect without demanding it. It’s the way they carry themselves—their posture, their speech, their confidence. As a child of the Most High, you carry the dignity of heaven.

This doesn’t mean arrogance; it means **holy confidence**. You are the righteousness of God in Christ Jesus. You are the head and not the tail, above only and not beneath. Let your life reflect this reality!

### 5. **Quality: Excellence is Your Standard**

Kings don’t settle for mediocrity. Daniel refused to defile himself with the king’s portion because he understood that royalty demands excellence. When you offer your service, your work, your worship—give your best. This is the hallmark of those who carry divine royalty.

### 6. **Security: Untouchable by Divine Decree**

The blood of Jesus has made you untouchable by the enemy! Just as the blood on the doorposts in Egypt caused death to pass over the Israelites, the blood of the Lamb marks you as protected, preserved, and untouchable.

Walk in this security. No weapon formed against you shall prosper. The enemy cannot touch what God has anointed!

### 7. **Righteousness: The Foundation of True Royalty**

All true royalty is founded on righteousness. Psalm 45:6 tells us: *”Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; a scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your Kingdom.”*

Your right standing with God is not based on your performance—it’s based on Christ’s finished work. Rest in this, and let righteousness flow through every area of your life.

## Your Daily Royal Decree

Begin each day with this powerful declaration:

*”I am a child of the Most High God, crowned with glory and honor. I carry the authority of heaven in my words. I walk in divine prosperity and supernatural favor. I am surrounded by God’s protection and sealed by His blood. Today, I reign in life through Christ Jesus! Every circumstance, every challenge, every obstacle bows to my royal authority. I am more than a conqueror. I am royalty!”*

## Call to Action: Step Into Your Throne

1. **Meditate on Your Identity:** Spend time this week in Psalm 8, 1 Peter 2, and Revelation 1. Let the Holy Spirit engrave your royal identity deep into your spirit.

2. **Practice Your Authority:** Start small. Speak to situations in your life with the authority of a king. Command peace into chaos, healing into sickness, provision into lack.

3. **Walk in Dignity:** Carry yourself like the royalty you are. Let your words, your dress, your conduct reflect your heavenly citizenship.

4. **Join the Royal Academy:** If you’re hungry to learn more about walking in your royal destiny, consider joining DUSOM’s upcoming School of Ministry. Here, you’ll be equipped to reign in every area of life.

title.rendered: When Heaven Breaks Through: Experiencing Life-Changing Divine Encounters

content.rendered:
# When Heaven Breaks Through: Experiencing Life-Changing Divine Encounters

![Divine Light Breaking Through](/blog-images/divine-encounter-1.jpg)

## Have You Ever Longed for More?

There’s a holy hunger that resides in the heart of every true believer—a craving that no earthly pleasure can satisfy, a thirst that religious routines cannot quench. It’s the deep, burning desire to encounter the living God.

Perhaps you’ve been walking with Jesus for years, yet something inside you whispers, *”There’s more. There has to be more.”*

You’re absolutely right.

Jacob discovered this “more” at a place he called Bethel—”the house of God.” What transformed a lonely, desperate runaway into a man who wrestled with God and prevailed? **One divine encounter.**

And that same transforming power is available to you today.

> “Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, ‘Surely the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.'” — Genesis 28:16

## The Relentless Pursuit of a Loving God

### From Running to Resting

Jacob was exhausted. Not just physically—soul-weary. He had deceived his father, stolen his brother’s blessing, and was now fleeing for his life. The sun had set on his dreams, his family, his future. With a stone for a pillow and the wilderness as his blanket, Jacob lay down in what seemed like the end of everything.

But here’s the beautiful mystery: **The very moment Jacob hit rock bottom, heaven opened wide.**

While Jacob slept, God drew near. A ladder appeared, bridging earth and heaven. Angels ascended and descended, carrying prayers upward and bringing answers down. And above it all stood the Lord Himself, speaking promises that would echo through eternity.

**Pause for a Moment:**
– Where in your life have you felt like Jacob—exhausted, at the end of your rope, wondering if God has forgotten you?
– Could it be that your “rock bottom” is actually God’s launching pad for your greatest encounter?

![Angelic Vision](/blog-images/divine-encounter-2.jpg)

## The Anatomy of a Divine Encounter

### 1. **The Relief That Refreshes Your Soul**

When heaven breaks through, weariness flees. Jacob entered that night a frightened fugitive; he awoke a man with a destiny. The encounter didn’t change his circumstances immediately—Esau was still angry, the journey was still long—but Jacob was forever changed.

Divine encounters infuse us with **supernatural stamina**. They remind us that we don’t navigate life’s challenges in our own strength—we’re carried by the Everlasting Arms.

**Activation Prayer:**
*”Lord, I’m tired of striving in my own strength. Pour out Your refreshing presence upon me. Let the weary places of my soul be flooded with Your peace. I receive supernatural rest right now, in Jesus’ name!”*

### 2. **Light in Your Darkest Night**

Jacob’s encounter happened at night—literally and figuratively. Sometimes God’s most spectacular visits come when everything around us is dark. The ladder of light piercing through the darkness was a prophetic picture: **No night is too dark for heaven to penetrate.**

Have you been walking through a season of spiritual darkness? Maybe you’ve felt distant from God, or circumstances have clouded your vision of His goodness. Take heart—the ladder is still standing! Angels are still ascending and descending. God is still speaking.

Your breakthrough is closer than you think.

### 3. **Angelic Activity Released**

Notice what Jacob saw: angels **ascending and descending**. They weren’t just coming down from heaven—they were going back up! This speaks of prayer and response, of earth’s cries reaching heaven and heaven’s answers returning to earth.

When you have a divine encounter, the veil between dimensions becomes thin. You become aware that **you are surrounded by a great cloud of witnesses**, ministering spirits sent to serve you, and the very presence of God Himself encamping around you.

*Psalm 91:11-12 declares: “For He shall give His angels charge over you, to keep you in all your ways. In their hands they shall bear you up…”*

![Prayer and Worship](/blog-images/divine-encounter-3.jpg)

### 4. **A Future Secured by Promise**

God didn’t just give Jacob a spiritual experience—He gave him a guarantee: *”Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done what I have spoken to you.”* (Genesis 28:15)

Divine encounters anchor your future in God’s faithfulness. They become markers in your spirit that you can return to when doubt arises. *”God met me here. He spoke to me. His promise stands.”*

## The Four Keys That Unlock Divine Encounters

### Key 1: **Value the Spiritual Above All**

Jacob’s brother Esau despised his birthright for a bowl of stew. Jacob, despite his flaws, valued spiritual blessing enough to wrestle for it, to wait for it, to pursue it at great personal cost.

**Question:** What are you willing to trade for an encounter with God? Entertainment? Comfort? Convenience? The depth of your hunger determines the height of your encounter.

### Key 2: **Embrace the Life of Sacrifice**

Divine encounters often require us to lay something down. Jacob left his home, his mother’s cooking, his familiar surroundings. The pathway to Bethel led through surrender.

What might God be asking you to surrender today? It could be:
– A relationship that’s pulling you away from God
– A habit that’s dulling your spiritual sensitivity
– A comfort zone that’s become a prison
– A dream you’ve been holding tighter than you hold Him

### Key 3: **Cultivate a Fighting Spirit**

Jacob was a fighter—from birth, he grasped his brother’s heel. But his greatest fight came later, when he wrestled with God Himself and refused to let go until he received a blessing.

God loves this tenacity! He invites us to press in, to persist, to wrestle with His promises until they manifest in our lives. **Don’t settle for surface-level Christianity.** Fight for the deep places. Wrestle for your blessing. Refuse to let go until heaven breaks through.

### Key 4: **Position Yourself for Visitation**

Jacob encountered God because he was in a place of vulnerability and openness. He wasn’t distracted by busyness or masked by pretense. He was simply… present.

Create space in your life for God to visit. Turn off the noise. Silence the notifications. Get alone with Him. The secret place is where secrets are revealed.

## Your Invitation to Bethel

Jacob marked the place of his encounter and called it Bethel—”the house of God.” He set up an altar and made a vow: *”If God will be with me, and keep me in this way that I am going, and give me bread to eat and clothing to put on, so that I come back to my father’s house in peace, then the Lord shall be my God.”*

Today, God extends the same invitation to you. He wants to be your God—not just in theory, but in daily, powerful, encounter-based reality.

**Will you meet Him at Bethel?**

## A Prayer for Divine Encounter

*Holy Spirit, I position myself for a fresh encounter with You. Remove every distraction, every barrier, every preconception that would keep me from experiencing Your presence. I declare that I am hungry—desperately hungry—for more of You.

Lord, let heaven break through in my life today. Visit me in my weariness. Speak to me in my confusion. Reveal Yourself in my ordinary moments. I refuse to let go until You bless me.

I believe that You are closer than I’ve realized. Open my eyes to see You, my ears to hear You, and my heart to receive everything You have for me. This is my Bethel moment. Let it be so, in Jesus’ mighty name! Amen!*

title.rendered: Covered by the Blood: The Power of Divine Preservation

content.rendered:
# Covered by the Blood: The Power of Divine Preservation

![Blood Covenant Protection](/blog-images/blood-covenant-1.jpg)

## The Scarlet Thread of Redemption

From the very first pages of Scripture to the triumphant finale of Revelation, one theme weaves through every chapter like a scarlet thread—the power of the blood. It’s the story of a God who would rather shed His own blood than lose His beloved children. It’s the chronicle of a divine exchange: His life for ours, His death for our life, His brokenness for our wholeness.

Tonight, I invite you on a journey through time and eternity. We’re going to trace the blood-marked path of God’s preserving power—from Eden’s first sacrifice to Calvary’s ultimate offering, and into your life today.

> “And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where you are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you…” — Exodus 12:13

## When God Sees the Blood

There’s something mysterious, something almost incomprehensible, about the power God has invested in blood. Leviticus 17:11 declares: *”For the life of the flesh is in the blood… it is the blood that makes an atonement for the soul.”*

When God sees the blood, something shifts in the spiritual realm. Judgment is stayed. Mercy is released. Protection is activated. And this isn’t just Old Testament theology—this is your present-day reality in Christ.

**The blood of Jesus is speaking right now on your behalf.** Can you hear it? It’s speaking better things than Abel’s blood. It’s declaring mercy where judgment should fall. It’s establishing a covenant that hell itself cannot break.

![Cross and Blood](/blog-images/blood-covenant-2.jpg)

## The Preservation Chronicles: Evidence Through History

### Chapter 1: The First Covering (Genesis 3:21)

Imagine the scene: Adam and Eve, trembling in shame among the fig leaves, hearing the footsteps of God approaching. They had disobeyed. Death had been pronounced. The future seemed hopeless.

But then—mercy!

“Unto Adam also and to his wife did the Lord God make coats of skins, and clothed them.”

Did you catch it? **Skins imply death.** An innocent animal gave its life so Adam and Eve could be covered. This was the first blood sacrifice, the first prophetic whisper of a Lamb who would one day give His life to cover all humanity.

From the very beginning, God established the pattern: **Blood covers. Blood preserves. Blood protects.**

### Chapter 2: The Scarlet Cord of Salvation (Joshua 2)

Rahab was a woman with a past. Living on the wall of Jericho, she had heard the stories of Israel’s God—and faith had been birthed in her heart. When the spies came, she hid them. When their lives were in danger, she lowered them down by a scarlet cord.

That red rope wasn’t just an escape route—it was a prophetic symbol. It marked her house for salvation when judgment fell on Jericho. The walls fell, the city was destroyed, but Rahab’s house **remained standing** because of the scarlet thread.

**The blood-marked house is an indestructible house.**

What are you marking with the blood of Jesus today? Your home? Your family? Your business? Your health? Mark it boldly! The enemy cannot touch what the blood has covered.

### Chapter 3: The Blood That Stopped the Plague (2 Samuel 24)

David had sinned. Pride had led him to number Israel, trusting in military might rather than in God. The consequence was devastating—a plague that claimed 70,000 lives.

But watch the mercy of God in action. The prophet Gad instructed David to build an altar on the threshing floor of Araunah and offer a sacrifice. As soon as the blood was shed, **the plague stopped.**

The blood sacrifice became a transaction of mercy. David’s repentance, combined with the shed blood, turned away the wrath of God and established peace.

What plague is threatening your life today? What destruction has the enemy unleashed against your family, your finances, your health? The blood of Jesus is still the answer! It has power to stop every plague, arrest every destruction, and turn every curse into blessing.

![Protection Shield](/blog-images/blood-covenant-3.jpg)

### Chapter 4: The Unparalleled Power of Jesus’ Blood

Every sacrifice we’ve mentioned—every animal, every offering—was merely a shadow. The substance, the reality, the fulfillment of them all is found in **the blood of Jesus.**

Listen to these life-changing truths about the blood:

**1. The Blood Ransoms**

Jesus declared: *”The Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”* (Matthew 20:28)

A ransom is a price paid to free a captive. You were held hostage by sin, by death, by the powers of darkness. Jesus paid the ultimate price—His own precious blood—to set you free. You are not for sale anymore. You belong to God!

**2. The Blood Transmits Life**

*”For the life of the flesh is in the blood…”* (Leviticus 17:11)

When you partake of communion—when you receive the body and blood of Christ by faith—you are not performing a ritual. You are **receiving life.** Divine, indestructible, resurrection life flows into your mortal body. Sickness cannot remain where this life enters. Death flees before its presence.

**3. The Blood Is a Weapon**

*”And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony…”* (Revelation 12:11)

The blood is not passive—it is a weapon of war! When you plead the blood of Jesus over your life, your family, your circumstances, you are releasing divine ammunition against the kingdom of darkness. Demons tremble. Strongholds crumble. The enemy’s plans are dismantled.

**4. The Blood Speaks**

*”…to Jesus the Mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better things than that of Abel.”* (Hebrews 12:24)

Abel’s blood cried out for vengeance from the ground. Jesus’ blood cries out for mercy, for forgiveness, for protection, for blessing. Right now, as you read these words, the blood is speaking over you—declaring you forgiven, healed, protected, and blessed!

**5. The Blood Channels Blessing**

*”The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ?”* (1 Corinthians 10:16)

The cup of blessing is connected to the blood. Isaiah 65:8 tells us that the blessing prevents destruction. When you are under the blood, you are under an open heaven of blessing that prevents every form of destruction from touching your life.

## How to Engage the Blood for Your Preservation

Knowing about the blood is not enough—we must learn to engage it actively. Here are three practical ways:

### 1. **Through the Communion Table**

Don’t treat communion as a religious ritual. Approach it as a **divine transaction**. When you hold the bread and the cup, let faith arise in your heart. Declare:

*”As I eat this bread and drink this cup, I am receiving the body broken for me and the blood shed for me. I am taking into my being divine life, divine health, divine protection. Every plague, every curse, every evil is passing over me because I am covered by the blood!”*

### 2. **By Faith Declarations**

Your mouth is a powerful instrument. Use it to release the power of the blood:

– *”I plead the blood of Jesus over my life and family.”*
– *”I cover my home, my business, my health with the blood of Jesus.”*
– *”No weapon formed against me shall prosper because I am blood-bought, blood-washed, and blood-covered!”*

### 3. **As Led by the Spirit**

Romans 8:14 says: *”For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.”*

There will be times when the Holy Spirit prompts you to do something specific—perhaps to anoint your doorposts with oil as an act of faith, or to take communion at an unusual time, or to declare the blood over a specific situation. Be sensitive and obey. These Spirit-led actions release extraordinary protection.

## A Prophetic Declaration Over Your Life

Right now, wherever you are, I want you to receive this word with faith:

*In the name of Jesus, I declare over your life that the preserving power of the blood is activated! Every plan of the enemy against you is thwarted. Every arrow of destruction is turned back. You and your household are marked for preservation.

You shall fulfill your days. You shall complete your assignment. Those who pursue you to destroy you shall experience their own destruction. The blood of Jesus speaks mercy, protection, and blessing over every area of your life.

You are covered. You are protected. You are preserved. In Jesus’ mighty name!*
